heading: 'what am i bid for these geeks?'
subheading: ebay adds another oddity to its online auction inventory. now you can bid on a complete team of network engineers and administrators.
author: wired news report
text: ebay calls itself "your personal trading community." now it can rename itself "your person trading community."on monday, a seller listed a complete team of 16 internet service provider engineers, opening the bidding at a whopping us$3.14 million.the description for the auction says that the team works for a major isp and is willing to leave as a group. buyers are limited to companies in silicon valley.the $3.14 million figure includes the salary of one director, three managers, seven senior engineers, and five administrators, along with a $320,000 signing bonus.the price might be a bit steep for ebay's normal buyers, more accustomed to buying figurines or antique brass belt buckles; as of tuesday morning, not a single bid had been placed.the team could not be reached for comment.
